remarks: A ring homomorphism is a function.  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 19-Jun-2010.)
statement:
rnghomf.1 $e |- G = ( 1st ` R ) $.
rnghomf.2 $e |- X = ran G $.
rnghomf.3 $e |- J = ( 1st ` S ) $.
rnghomf.4 $e |- Y = ran J $.
rngohomf $p |- ( ( R e. RingOps /\ S e. RingOps /\ F e. ( R RngHom S ) ) -> F : X --> Y ) $.
